channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [BOOKKEEPER-630] Add tag to o.a.b.net.* to indict which release of hadoop they came from, move DNS to o.a.b.net.* and indent
item.description: We didn't reformat the code before bringing it in from hadoop commons in the patch of BOOKKEEPER-618.
item.summary: Add tag to o.a.b.net.* to indict which release of hadoop they came from, move DNS to o.a.b.net.* and indent

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: The formatting shouldn't be changed. If we want to update the code, we will need to pull in from hadoop again. If the formatting has changed completely, it will be much harder to see what has changed.

It is a bit odd to have files formatted differently, but I understand your motivation, Ivan. What I was thinking is that if we are to pull changes for that file in the future, we could reformat the patched java file when generating a bookkeeper patch. The patch would include the changes to the code plus any necessary format conversion. What do you think?

I've just seen that I actually put DNS is a different package than Sijie Guo did in the rack awareness patch. We should put them both in one place. Also, he changed indentation whereas I did not. We should agree on one and fixup the files as necessary. Also, I tagged the files with the version I copied from. All the files should have this.

So, I've renamed the patch to make these fixups once they're decided. My votes on the matters are.

  • No preference on package name.
  • No indentation changes, for the reasons given above.

for indentation issue, how possible we would pull the changes for copy-paste code? or how we would track the changes for the code we copied? In reality, if we want to track upstream changes, it would be better to use package dependency; when we copied the code, it means somehow we break the dependency with upstream changes, we are already on the way to maintain even fix the part of code. It is a tradeoff between porting code and include dependency. No preference for me. If we agreed on copying the code, I prefer what Flavio said for future changes.

If we agreed on copying code, I would suggest put in in net package rather than util.net package.

for indentation issue, how possible we would pull the changes for copy-paste code?

It would be copy paste again. But we could cleanly diff against the previous version in hadoop to see what mods we had made. It's not 100% clean either way. If you and flavio both think we should change the indentation, we'll do that.
Sijie Guo, I can add the tag, but can you confirm which release it came from?
my release, i mean the hadoop-commons release btw.
removed from 4.2.2 as there's only the DNS file for that release, and this has the indent and namespace fixed in the branch-4.2 branch.
attach a patch to add tag to o.a.b.net.* where they came from, move DNS to o.a.b.net.* and fix indention.
